title: This Trompe l’Oeil TV (That Turns Into a Piece of Art) Is on Sale
text:
1 item in this article Photo: Courtesy Retailer

We’ve come a long way from the days of debating plasma TVs versus LCD. These days, the highest-quality smart TVs compete on 4K displays, HDR, and ultra-HD — and all of these are features of this Samsung 55-inch Frame TV. The acronym that’s most important here is QLED, or quantum dot LED. That’s the technology Samsung has pioneered to ensure high-quality depth of color from every image that appears on this screen, from super-black blacks to bright whites and literally billions of shades of color in between.

That rich color is especially important on the Frame TV, which has a picture-frame-like border (hence the name), can be mounted to the wall like a painting, and transforms into a still work of art when not being used as a TV. So the QLED display means you’ll be watching the new Avengers movie or Bachelor in Paradise in glorious 4K, but no one will even know that there’s a TV hidden in that lovely framed painting on your wall. And right now, this trompe l’oeil 55-inch TV from Samsung is as cheap as it’s ever been: just $1,398, or $400 off the list price.
